title: Pen y Crug Walk Route

images.title: Old waymarker post on the footpath near Pen-y-crug by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old waymarker post on the footpath near Pen-y-crug

images.title: Alan Bowring / View from Pen-y-crug
images.caption: View from Pen-y-crug. From the break in the defensive ditches encircling the summit of the hill, this view over Brecon can be enjoyed. The hill at centre right - Slwch Tump - also boasts an Iron Age hillfort.

images.title: Ruth Sharville / Gate to the open ground, Pen-y-crug
images.caption: Gate to the open ground, Pen-y-crug

images.title: Simon Ashton-Jones / The Crug from the edge of Pyscodlyn Farm
images.caption: The Crug from the edge of Pyscodlyn Farm

images.title: Pen-y-crug viewed from Cradoc by Jaggery, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pen-y-crug viewed from Cradoc

description: This walk climbs to the ancient hill fort and viewpoint on Pen-y-crug hill in Powys in the Brecon Beacons. The hill is located just to the north west of the town of Brecon. From the town you can follow public footpaths up to the 331 metre high summit. Here you will find an Iron Age hillfort with excellent views over the River Usk Valley and the mountains of the Brecon Beacons.
